content: what is  hotosm: change task style when at 100%?

The HOTOSM (Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team) project is an initiative that aims to create and provide free, detailed, and up-to-date maps for humanitarian and development purposes. 

When the task style changes at 100%, it typically means that the mapping task assigned to volunteers on the HOTOSM platform has been completed. The task style, which usually includes a specific focus area or requirement, is adjusted to indicate that all the mapping activities related to that task have been finished. This allows the project coordinators and volunteers to easily track the progress and status of map completion.
